title: NVIDIA RTX 4090 (24GB VRAM)
description: The Gold Standard. Runs Llama-3 70B (quantized) and huge image generation models fast.

title: NVIDIA RTX 3090 (Used/Refurb - 24GB)
description: The Budget King. Same VRAM as 4090 but half the price. Slower, but perfect for starters.

title: Apple Mac Studio (M2 Ultra - 192GB RAM)
description: Memory Monster. The only way to run massive 120B+ parameter models locally without a server rack.

title: Apple Mac Mini (M4 Pro - 32GB RAM)
description: The Efficient Edge. Perfect for 7B/13B models and 24/7 distinct agents.

title: Dual RTX 3090 Rig (48GB VRAM Total)
description: The 'Split' Strategy. Run 70B models comfortably by splitting them across two cards.

title: Used Dell R730 Server (Tesla P40 24GB)
description: The Loud Laboratory. Enterprise gear for cheap. Warning: It's loud and hot.

title: No Additional Storage
description: I'll stick with the boot drive.

title: 22TB WD Red Pro NAS Drive
description: Data Hoarder. Store the entire internet (almost).

title: 12TB Seagate IronWolf (Value Pick)
description: Sweet Spot. Good balance of price per TB.

title: 4TB NVMe SSD (Gen 4 - Fast)
description: Speed Demon. For loading models instantly.

title: RAID 5 Array (3x 12TB Drives)
description: Redundancy. If one drive fails, you lose nothing.

title: Raspberry Pi 5 (8GB) - Starter Node
description: The Toy. Good for learning, bad for serious AI.
